page.description: Set the overlay HTML for the "editor" or "view" part.

argument.name: part
argument.description: Which overlay to set. Values can be "editor" or "view".

argument.name: type
argument.description: The type of navigation to do. Values can be "left", "right", "up" and "down" with the optional "nudge-" prefix to move a smaller amount. Writing directions such as "forward", "back", "new-line", "prev-line", "next-line", "line-start", "line-end", "start" and "end". Lastly "scale" can be used to adjust the scale the ink is viewed at.

argument.name: scaleType
argument.description: If using "scale", there are several scale options. A numeric value will set the ink scale in terms of ink "dots" to pixels on the screen. A string value can either be "in" or "out" to zoom in or out, or can be a zoom percent such as "100%" in terms of ink units to display size. This means that at "100%" a 5x3in ink would display as 5x3in. If an object is passed in then some form of "fit" is expected. This will scale the ink to fit the availble space.

argument.name: fit
argument.description: The fit type, can be "both", "width" or "height".

argument.name: margin
argument.description: The number of pixels to add to the edges of the ink when scaling.

argument.name: autoScale
argument.description: Whether to turn auto scaling on. If "true", then the scale will automatically refresh when the ink control is resized.
